page.p: The OpenMath website, including its CDs, is built from files in a GitHub git repository. The repository is publicly readable but needs credentials to commit.
... is the URL of that repository. GitHub also provides a Subversion interface at
... which can be used by subversion clients to checkout the repository.
Write access is gained by being added to the github organisation. Alternatively, one can use the standard GitHub workflow of making pull requests.

The website is built by an ant file, explained in the website-build triggered latest one hour after a commit. This build is run with a "normal ant" with the addition of the saxon jar so that XSLT 2 and/or Saxon extensions can run. Those who wish to adjust the website are encouraged to checkout only the "non-mass" part of it, since the "mass" part of it is made of many static resources such as slide' copies. The non-mass part is in the directory www.
